for statement

The for statement is similar to the while statement, but it is more complex.
The syntax is as follows:
for(Clause 1; Clause 2; Clause 3)     statement or block
Here, Clause 1 specifies an expression to be executed before entering the loop. You can also perform variable declarations here; variables declared in this section remain valid throughout the loop (they are deleted upon exiting the loop). This clause can also be omitted.

Clause 2 specifies a conditional expression. As long as this expression is true, the statement or block is executed repeatedly. If omitted, it is always considered true.

Clause 3 specifies an expression to be executed at the end of the statement or block. This can also be omitted.

In terms of operation:
(1) First, execute Clause 1.
(2) Evaluate Clause 2; if it is false, the loop ends without evaluating the statement or block.
(3) Execute the statement or block.
(4) Execute Clause 3.
(5) Evaluate Clause 2; if it is false, exit the loop.
(6) Repeat from (3).

If there is a break statement within the block, it exits the loop at that point. If there is a continue statement, it jumps to (4).


Example:
    var i,a=1;
    for(i=1;i<5;i++)
    {
        a*=i;
    }

    var i;
    for(i=0;i<10;i++)
    {
        if(obj[i]==0) continue; // i++ is executed even if continue is used
        if(obj[i]==1) break; // break exits immediately
        func(obj[i]);
    }
